Text.Value: Victory is ours - alas, not without consequence.
A face I once trusted, now allied with the shadows' most favoured.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises bow and points at the player.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Arrow pulled back on longbow foley

Text.Value: Give me the lantern. You must come to Last Light.
I'm infected with their parasite, but I'm seeking a cure.
Our objectives complete without drawing a weapon. Incredible work.

EditorData.logicalname: Came with Harpers hasmet - Avoided combat
LOGIC - None of them has the lantern

Text.Value: Here - Jaheira insists you take the lantern. It will guide you safely to Moonrise Towers.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper hands player the Moonlantern
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Clink of lantern being passed over and stored

Text.Value: Last Light? Tell me more.
Incredible. A light that chases away even the deepest shadows.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

Text.Value: A cultist deserter? By the gods.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

Text.Value: Lead on, then.
Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on his kind?
Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on her kind?
Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on their kind?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>

Text.Value: The cult took me prisoner. Thank the gods you came when you did.
Hand over the lantern.
*The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

EditorData.stateContext: Neither Harper nor player holding lantern

Text.Value: Apologies - I had no word of this mission. Take comfort in knowing there will many more yet.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

EditorData.stateContext: Harper no longer points bow at player.

Text.Value: Well played, you have a gift for cunning. Take the lantern - you earned it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>

Text.Value: What is this? A cultist after all, then - vermin for crushing.
I couldn't bear the atrocities committed in the Absolute's name.
Go on - take the lantern from the corpse.
I'm not here to explain myself - I just want the lantern. Hand it over, or die.
Explain.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow

Text.Value: Keep the lantern - Jaheira insisted. It will guide you safely to Moonrise Towers.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>

Text.Value: Stay close, and be wary of the shadows. I'll mark your map, should the way be lost.

EditorData.logicalname: Harper marks player's map with Last Light

Text.Value: I've merely heeded my calling, friend.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

Text.Value: Sorry. I don't have it anymore.

EditorData.logicalname: Player doesn't have lantern - Logic node

Text.Value: Of which there have been many, I assure you. I am glad you've broken free.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

Text.Value: Breathe easy, then - you are a captive no longer.
Then it's time you shed your bonds and joined a righteous cause.
An inn, at first glance - but also a safe haven, free from the curse's tendrils, or so it's been promised.
Examine the corpse. The lantern is yours to take.
I will make my way there in my own time.
I'm not one of them. They took me prisoner.
Attack the woman.
I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.
Another wretch among many. And another kill for my list.
Incredible. A light that chases away even the deepest shadows.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

Text.Value: How about I just kill you and keep the lantern for myself?
A prisoner? Of course - and you would not be the first.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

Text.Value: Thank you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG][NOJIRA] Clink of lantern being passed over and stored

Text.Value: *You notice a pin on the woman's chest, identical to the one you found in Grymforge. She is a Harper.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

Text.Value: You must rest. Come - I will take you to Last Light.

EditorData.AnimationTags: REUSE - Player lifts Moonlantern up and holds need an idle.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

Text.Value: Then permit me to mark your map. We will await, for when you are at your most weary.
But it will not slay the creatures that emerge from the darkness. Be vigilant 'til the last.
I succumbed to their temptations. You gave me an opportunity to escape.
*The pin the woman wears is familiar to you. She belongs to the Harpers, a covert organisation dedicated to freedom and balance.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

Text.Value: Lead on, then.
*The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

Text.Value: You. Don't move a godsdamned muscle.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises bow and points at the player.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Arrow pulled back on longbow foley

Text.Value: A lie, clear as the Chionthar's waters. And for that, you will bleed.
My goddess protects me. I'll find my own way there.

EditorData.logicalname: Avatar Shadowheart - Not enemy of Shar

EditorData.AnimationTags: REUSE - Harper lifts Moonlantern up and holds need an idle.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper lifts lantern into the air. Its glow illuminates his face,
EditorData.logicalname: Player didn't take lantern in combat

Synopsis: Femme Harper Ranger after the fight with the Drider. To ppath: You started the fight with the drider, but switched sides. If you don't give the Harpers the moonlantern they came for, you will need to fight them for it.
